g.text: PERSON INTERVIEWEDDATE OF INTERVIEWTIME OF INTERVIEWCASE NUMBERINTERVIEW CONDUCTED BYTRANSCRIBED BY
Officer: What was your role at Raytheon Technologies?
Alice: I was the assistant to Robert.
Officer: Was that your only job? Some people seem to think yourlevel of involvement in the company was more than just that.

Alice: Robert trusted me, he knows I’m well educated. It’s naturalfor an assistant to have access to company information. I’m involved in Roberts affairs so naturally I knew about what was going on in the company.
Officer: Were you aware of any new chemicals being created in the labs?
Alice: I was never involved with the workings of the lab, I helped Robert with the broader scope.
Officer: So you knew who he was planning to have takeover the companywhen he retired?
Alice: Robert was always secretive about that, but I believe he had made his choice. One day I walked in on him writing something on a piece of paper, when he saw me he immediately hid it.
Officer: How do you know that he was writing who his replacement would be?
Alice: I know Robert and he never writes unless it’s a speech, I do all of his writing for him and that’s all typewriter. He didn’t have any speeches to write except the one about his retirement.
